thread.title: UCLA CB Ishmael Adams to face misdemeanor battery charge- UCLA Blog:
thread.title_full: UCLA CB Ishmael Adams to face misdemeanor battery charge- UCLA Blog: Orange County Register

title: UCLA CB Ishmael Adams to face misdemeanor battery charge- UCLA Blog:
text:
The Los Angeles City Attorney's Office filed a misdemeanor charge of battery Monday against UCLA cornerback Ishmael Adams .
In August, Adams was arrested for allegedly using force to steal an Uber driver's cell phone and was indefinitely suspended from the team as a result.
He was reinstated before the Bruins' Pac-12 opener at Arizona on Sept. 26 when prosecutors from the Los Angeles District Attorney's Office declined to file felony charges. The case was then referred to the city attorney's office.
"We feel, as a program, he’s missed a quarter of his season and shown remorse for the actions that he’s taken," Coach Jim Mora said on Sept. 22 when he announced Adams' reinstatement. "He’s accepted responsibility. He’s accepted the consequences. He’s apologized profusely to his team, his teammates, this staff, and he’s come back with a great attitude.
"So we’re going to move forward that way. If things change, we’ll adjust."
A UCLA spokesperson declined to comment on the development.
Adams is scheduled to be arraigned in Los Angeles Superior Court on Nov. 16.
The 5-foot-8 junior started in last week's 56-35 loss at Stanford. Last season, he was an All-Pac-12 first-team selection.
